name: Instance
shortDesc: The AWS::EC2::Instance type creates an Amazon EC2 instance.

properties.name: AvailabilityZone
properties.desc: Specifies the name of the Availability Zone in which the instance is located.

properties.name: BlockDeviceMappings
properties.desc: Defines a set of Amazon Elastic Block Store block device mappings, ephemeral instance store block device mappings, or both. For more information, see Amazon Elastic Block Store or Amazon EC2 Instance Store in the Amazon EC2 User Guide for Linux Instances.
properties.type: A list of Amazon EC2 Block Device Mapping Property.
properties.update: Replacement. If you change only the DeleteOnTermination property for one or more block devices, update requires No interruption.

properties.name: DisableApiTermination
properties.desc: Specifies whether the instance can be terminated through the API.

properties.name: EbsOptimized
properties.desc: Specifies whether the instance is optimized for Amazon Elastic Block Store I/O. This optimization provides dedicated throughput to Amazon EBS and an optimized configuration stack to provide optimal EBS I/O performance.
properties.update: Some interruptions for Amazon EBS-backed instances

properties.name: IamInstanceProfile
properties.desc: The physical ID (resource name) of an instance profile or a reference to an AWS::IAM::InstanceProfile resource.

properties.name: ImageId
properties.desc: Provides the unique ID of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) that was assigned during registration.

properties.name: InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior
properties.desc: Indicates whether an instance stops or terminates when you shut down the instance from the instance's operating system shutdown command. You can specify stop or terminate. For more information, see the RunInstances command in the Amazon EC2 API Reference.

properties.name: InstanceType
properties.desc: The instance type, such as t2.micro. The default type is "m1.small". For a list of instance types, see Instance Families and Types.
properties.update: Some interruptions for Amazon EBS-backed instances

properties.name: KernelId
properties.desc: The kernel ID.
properties.update: Some interruptions for Amazon EBS-backed instances

properties.name: KeyName
properties.desc: Provides the name of the Amazon EC2 key pair.

properties.name: Monitoring
properties.desc: Specifies whether monitoring is enabled for the instance.

properties.name: NetworkInterfaces
properties.desc: A list of embedded objects that describe the network interfaces to associate with this instance.
properties.type: A list of EC2 NetworkInterface Embedded Property Type

properties.name: PlacementGroupName
properties.desc: The name of an existing placement group that you want to launch the instance into (for cluster instances).

properties.name: PrivateIpAddress
properties.desc: The private IP address for this instance.

properties.name: RamdiskId
properties.desc: The ID of the RAM disk to select. Some kernels require additional drivers at launch. Check the kernel requirements for information about whether you need to specify a RAM disk. To find kernel requirements, go to the AWS Resource Center and search for the kernel ID.
properties.update: Some interruptions for Amazon EBS-backed instances

properties.name: SecurityGroupIds
properties.desc: A list that contains the security group IDs for VPC security groups to assign to the Amazon EC2 instance. If you specified the NetworkInterfaces property, do not specify this property.
properties.update: No interruption for instances that are in a VPC.

properties.name: SecurityGroups
properties.desc: Valid only for Amazon EC2 security groups. A list that contains the Amazon EC2 security groups to assign to the Amazon EC2 instance. The list can contain both the name of existing Amazon EC2 security groups or references to AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup resources created in the template.

properties.name: SourceDestCheck
properties.desc: Controls whether source/destination checking is enabled on the instance. Also determines if an instance in a VPC will perform network address translation (NAT).

properties.name: SsmAssociations
properties.desc: The Amazon EC2 Simple Systems Manager (SSM) document and parameter values to associate with this instance. To use this property, you must specify an IAM role for the instance. For more information, see Prerequisites for Remotely Running Commands on EC2 Instances in the Amazon EC2 User Guide for Microsoft Windows Instances.
properties.type: List of Amazon EC2 Instance SsmAssociations.

properties.name: SubnetId
properties.desc: If you're using Amazon VPC, this property specifies the ID of the subnet that you want to launch the instance into. If you specified the NetworkInterfaces property, do not specify this property.

properties.name: Tags
properties.desc: An arbitrary set of tags (keyâ€“value pairs) for this instance.

properties.name: Tenancy
properties.desc: The tenancy of the instance that you want to launch. This value can be either "default" or "dedicated". An instance that has a tenancy value of "dedicated" runs on single-tenant hardware and can be launched only into a VPC. For more information, see Using EC2 Dedicated Instances Within Your VPC in the Amazon VPC User Guide.

properties.name: UserData
properties.desc: Base64-encoded MIME user data that is made available to the instances.
properties.update: Some interruptions for Amazon EBS-backed instances.

properties.name: Volumes
properties.desc: The Amazon EBS volumes to attach to the instance.

properties.name: AdditionalInfo
properties.desc: Reserved.
properties.update: Some interruptions for Amazon EBS-backed instances

attributes.name: AvailabilityZone
attributes.desc: The Availability Zone where the specified instance is launched. For example: us-east-1b.You can retrieve a list of all Availability Zones for a region by using the Fn::GetAZs intrinsic function.

attributes.name: PrivateDnsName
attributes.desc: The private DNS name of the specified instance. For example: ip-10-24-34-0.ec2.internal.

attributes.name: PublicDnsName
attributes.desc: The public DNS name of the specified instance. For example: ec2-107-20-50-45.compute-1.amazonaws.com.

attributes.name: PrivateIp
attributes.desc: The private IP address of the specified instance. For example: 10.24.34.0.

attributes.name: PublicIp
attributes.desc: The public IP address of the specified instance. For example: 192.0.2.0.
